title: post
values: On January 21, 2013, President Obama and Vice President Biden will be sworn in for a second term. Sign up here to stay up to date: http://OFA.BO/GUKx4o
President Obama responds to the hundreds of thousands of people who signed petitions calling for reduced gun violence.
A favorite photo: VP Biden greets a family at a campaign rally in Lakewood, Ohio last month.
President Obama and Vice President Biden are committed to keeping taxes low for American families and small businesses. Share your story and tell Congress to get it done now: http://OFA.BO/EnLPwo
Find out how Vice President Biden will be leading the administration’s effort to reduce gun violence in the United States: http://OFA.BO/DyvXpn

"This is no time to add any additional burden for middle class people.”—Vice President Biden at a Virginia diner last week on why Congress should extend tax breaks for families and small businesses. Here’s what you can do to help: http://OFA.BO/n7tgBw
VP Biden did some holiday shopping at Costco yesterday, and urged Congress to extend tax cuts for American families and small businesses: http://OFA.BO/WB6r2k
Happy birthday, Vice President Biden!
Best wishes for a happy and safe Thanksgiving.
Volunteers, donors, and voters like you helped secure a second term for President Obama and VP Biden. Take a quick survey to help determine where we go next: http://OFA.BO/rvtWEy
A favorite photo: VP Biden brings pizza to a campaign field office in Virginia earlier this month.
See how President Obama and Vice President Biden are working to help middle-class families get ahead: http://OFA.BO/fC8ey7
Check out photos from election night: http://OFA.BO/SEwign
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.
Four more years.
If you voted today, make sure your friends know it: http://OFA.BO/ohbJ8d
Go vote! Look up your polling place here: http://OFA.BO/dgaNnL
Time to get out the vote—here’s what you can do right now: http://OFA.BO/1jc3T2
It’s a great day to vote for President Obama and VP Biden! Grab a friend and head to your local polling place: http://OFA.BO/MysCMe
Election Day is here! Find out where you’ll be voting tomorrow: http://OFA.BO/kpL7nG

“We’re going to add 100,000 new math and science teachers over the next 10 years so our kids are the best in the world.”—VP Biden in Ohio yesterday. Check out the rest of President Obama and VP Biden’s plans for the next four years: http://OFA.BO/iTPFnF
So many accomplishments, they didn’t fit on one graphic. Share the one that’s most important to you.
Just 3 days remain until all the votes are counted. Call voters in key states today: http://OFA.BO/zV9baZ
Like and share this photo if you want to keep these two in the White House for four more years.
A few hours of your time today will help us win on Tuesday—get started now: http://ofa.bo/gotv
VP Biden: “President Obama and I will never turn Medicare from a guaranteed system into a voucher.” Get the facts: http://OFA.BO/YNjXXY
Get out there this weekend and help get out the vote! OFA.BO/GOTV

“When Governor Romney was asked, ‘do you think women are entitled to equal pay for equal work,’ what did he do? He started talking about binders. It’s amazing.”—VP Biden in Sarasota, Florida yesterday
Let’s move forward for four more years: http://OFA.BO/KPG6vw
“When America stands together, we’re all better off.”—VP Biden in Youngstown, Ohio yesterday
President Obama and Vice President Biden are taking us forward on equal pay and women’s health—Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan would take us back: http://OFA.BO/fCjBSY
Get a thumbs up from VP Biden: Find out if your state has early voting or mail-in ballots, and vote as soon as you can. http://OFA.BO/xc4KLw
Say cheese!

Greeting supporters in Kenosha, WI

“Mitt Romney has shown he’s very good at sending jobs away from America. But, Governor, I got news for you: A President’s job is to create jobs in America, for Americans, bringing jobs home to America.”—VP Biden in Kenosha, WI
Oshkosh, Wisconsin for Obama-Biden
Taking the stage in Kenosha, WI
Your vote could make the difference. Find out if you can be one of the first to cast a ballot for Team Obama-Biden: http://OFA.BO/pGdkkh
Spread the word on Obamacare during Breast Cancer Awareness Month.
“This is a President who says what he means, means what he says, and does what he says.”—VP Biden introducing President Obama in Ohio yesterday
Share this if you think President Obama should be our commander in chief for four more years.
There are only 15 days until the election—and it’s easy to make a difference from home: http://OFA.BO/1pHnDU
There are just a few weekends left before Election Day. Get out there and volunteer in your community—then treat yourself to some ice cream: http://OFA.BO/CQWWqT
Vice President Biden, speaking yesterday in Greeley, Colorado, on Romney’s immigration stance: “He’s not only out of touch with the Hispanic community, he’s out of touch with the American people.”
Share this if you agree that President Obama and Vice President Biden’s plan is the right one for all of us.
Vice President Biden on what’s at stake in this election for the Latino community.
Share this to say you’re on Team Obama-Biden tonight—debate live-stream coverage begins at 9 p.m. ET. http://OFA.BO/m8UVZj
Show your support for VP Biden before the vice presidential debate this week: http://OFA.BO/YmBoCf

“Any one of you who are on Medicare know that since President Obama has been elected President and changed the law, Medicare recipients have more benefits.”—VP Biden in Council Bluffs, Iowa on Thursday
We’re moving forward—spread the word: http://OFA.BO/hzc3eh
President Obama has a specific, concrete plan for strengthening the middle class—share this to spread the word: http://OFA.BO/F7vKcp
Don’t miss a special message from VP Biden after the first presidential debate tomorrow night—find a watch party near you: http://OFA.BO/t3vyRm

Vice President Biden on the Romney-Ryan Medicare plan: “The first thing they would do is eliminate the new benefits—800 bucks more for prescription drugs, wellness visits, co-pays. It would also move the Medicare trust fund to insolvency in 2016.”
“Look at the facts. President Obama has increased the benefits available to people on Medicare today by the action he took.”—VP Biden in Boca Raton, Florida
VP Biden visits Mel’s Diner in Ft. Myers, Florida.
Your donation to help re-elect President Obama and Vice President Biden goes the farthest before midnight tonight. Pitch in $5 now: http://OFA.BO/wyEyGQ

“Instead of attacking folks who work for a living and pay their way, Romney should be respecting their hard work. That’s the job of a president. To lift people up, not to tear them down.”—Vice President Biden in Chesterfield, Virginia this week
40 days till Election Day. Let’s do this thing: http://OFA.BO/Dk4KBT
Free car magnet! http://OFA.BO/oao4vh
“I’ve never gone anywhere without the Teamsters.”—VP Biden speaking to firefighters, teachers, and other union members in Manchester, NH
VP Biden gives a pep talk at Newport High School in Newport, NH.
The VP and Dr. Biden talked to supporters at Dartmouth College about President Obama’s record of strengthening early childhood and secondary education.
How the Bidens do fall (with a 36-pound pumpkin).
We've got the last Dinner with Barack of this campaign coming right up, and you should give it a shot: http://OFA.BO/3aoCUg
Two days in Iowa with Vice President Biden.

“Every day, Barack and Joe are working so that every single American has an opportunity to provide for themselves and their families.”—Dr. Jill Biden in Minnesota last week. Pass it on if you agree: http://OFA.BO/Yj5LyC
Don’t miss this backstage peek at the Democratic National Convention, featuring VP Biden, Barack Obama, and Michelle Obama.

“It’s never been a good bet to bet against America!”—VP Biden in Zanesville, Ohio
The VP stopped in for pizza and conversation at Cardo’s Pizza in Jackson, Ohio.
The VP visits Obama for America - Ohio volunteers in Athens.
Over convention week, more than 700,000 grassroots donors committed to supporting this team in this election. Join them: http://OFA.BO/VaeCV9
Tune in tonight to see VP Biden and President Obama’s speeches at the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, and spread the word.
VP Biden. Kal Penn. Coming tomorrow to a livestream near you.
Joe Biden in Lordstown - August 31st
Three smiles for the VP in Mahoning, Ohio.
“They call their plan new, bold, and gutsy. There’s nothing gutsy about giving another trillion in tax cuts to millionaires.”—Vice President Biden on the Romney-Ryan plan
VP Biden samples the fare at the Canfield Fair in Mahoning, Ohio.

La Crosse, Wisconsin was fired up for VP Biden and Dr. Biden last week. Find out about upcoming Obama 2012 events near you: http://OFA.BO/m9eKUW
"I want my daughters and granddaughters to have the same rights today and in the future as my sons and grandsons do."—VP Biden in La Crosse, Wisconsin this week
Like and share this photo if you’re proud of VP Biden in last night’s debate.

Before VP Biden debates Rep. Ryan tomorrow, make sure everyone you know has the facts on where they stand.
Read Kobe’s story of meeting Vice President Biden: http://OFA.BO/nGDqnb

VP Biden on Mitt Romney: “He called for a tax plan that would mean massive cuts for the wealthy, but he refused to explain how he could possibly pay for them without raising taxes on middle-class families.”
Heart-to-heart in Ft. Myers, Florida.
“There is no way to separate retirement security from the notion of family security.”—VP Biden in Tamarac, Florida on the need to strengthen Social Security and Medicare for the long haul
Impromptu phonebanking in Boca Raton, Florida.
Mitt Romney’s tax plan could lead to higher costs for seniors—send an eCard to spread the word: http://OFA.BO/xKLhR9

Team huddle.

First stop in the Granite State: a farm stand in New London for pies and pumpkins.
Getting a lift in Hanover, New Hampshire.
Pancakes at the Airport Diner in Manchester, NH

Vice President Biden on Mitt Romney’s comments disparaging 47% of Americans: “He thinks these folks believe they’re entitled, that they’ve become dependent, they see themselves as victims who won’t take responsibility for their own lives. How could he be so profoundly wrong about America? Not in my neighborhood. Not where I grew up.  Not the people I know.”
Support the candidates who are fighting for every American: http://OFA.BO/UDa3WY
Out of many, we are one.
Share widely.

Check out the highlights from Vice President Biden’s trip to Eau Claire, Wisconsin.
VP Biden takes a candid photo with supporters in Portsmouth, Ohio.
Treat time in Nelsonville, Ohio.
A friendly turnout for VP Biden in Milford, Ohio.

A party platform to move this country forward.
Supporters of all ages welcomed the VP to Lordstown, Ohio.
Saying "cheese."

Mitt Romney invested in companies that shipped U.S. jobs overseas. Share this image if you think that’s the wrong bet for America.
“Let’s finish what we started. Let’s meet this moment together. We need you to stand with us.”—Vice President Biden
In Minneapolis, Vice President Biden spoke out against Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan’s trickle-down economics plan: “There’s overwhelming evidence that their policies will not grow the economy.”
Detroit was excited to host Vice President Biden.
See how President Obama is making college more affordable for students and their parents with our education calculator: http://OFA.BO/PB9xjf
“When you get hit, get up. When you get knocked down, get up. There's no quit in America. There's no damn thing we can't do.”—Vice President Biden in Minnesota yesterday
Summer’s not over yet—enjoy some outdoor beverages with a “Cheers, Champ” can holder: http://OFA.BO/jpEm5Y
Vice President Biden talked about the President’s plan to strengthen the middle class, fought back against GOP attacks, and made new friends in North Carolina and Virginia this week.
Three years ago today, Sonia Sotomayor was sworn in as the Supreme Court’s 111th justice.
President Obama is fighting to protect early voting in Ohio—get the facts: http://OFA.BO/fneF6K
A can’t-miss video.
The pundits are saying the other side’s spending advantage could lose the election for President Obama and VP Biden. Help prove them wrong by pitching in $10 today: http://OFA.BO/VcmoGt
Thumbs up for Obama-Biden in Detroit.
The VP gave a pep talk to football players at South High School in Minneapolis.

Vice President Biden was joined in Detroit, Michigan by Claressa Shields—the first-ever American woman and only member of our 2012 Olympic team to win a boxing gold medal—and a big supporter of the President.
Vice President Biden paying a visit to the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe, the most holy Roman Catholic site in Mexico, this March. Join Catholics for Obama today: http://OFA.BO/vwvmU5
Everything you need to know about the campaign in the palm of your hand. Download the new Obama app: http://OFA.BO/Htwybc
Election Day is only three months away—make sure you’re registered and ready to vote: http://OFA.BO/JjroUm
Can you spot the Vice President?
Today is the most important fundraising deadline yet for this campaign. Pitch in $10 now: http://OFA.BO/zoUpke
Pep talk.
Pass this along to your friends and family who could use a reminder of how President Obama is helping small businesses grow and create jobs.
The Vice President greets a young supporter.
The VP checks out the Edison Welding Institute on the Ohio State University campus.
The VP takes his Strengthening the Middle Class tour to the Hawkeye State.
"Every opportunity."
The President is in Iowa today to make the case for extending middle-class tax cuts. Watch the VP lay out the stakes for the middle class in this election in Waterloo, Iowa last month.
Vice President Biden visited with the Sisters of Mount St. Francis during a campaign stop in Dubuque, Iowa last week.
“We need to choose between a commander-in-chief and an outsourcer-in-chief.”—VP Biden

The VP fired up the crowd at the United Auto Workers hall in Waterloo, had lunch with grassroots supporters, and enjoyed an afternoon ice cream break in Manchester on the first day of his bus tour through Iowa.

"This is a fight for the soul of this country. It's a fight for the middle class. ... It's about making sure America's fire departments, police departments continue to be a large part of the American fabric and be able to do their job. … And it's about a President and I who are prepared to fight like crazy to do whatever we can to make sure that you have the resources to be able to protect us."—VP Biden speaking at a fire station in Flint, Michigan
Vice President Biden jokes with President Obama and senior advisor David Plouffe in the Outer Oval Office.
The VP surprises Obama for America - North Carolina volunteers in Winston-Salem.
President Obama: "There's nothing I take more seriously than my responsibility to those who sacrifice their own safety to defend ours."
Follow VP Biden’s path on the campaign trail with the new “Joe Biden on the Road” Pinterest board: http://OFA.BO/o2J7a6

The Staffilino family of Martins Ferry, Ohio feared they would have to close their Chevy dealership a few years ago. Thanks to President Obama’s emergency loans to GM and Chrysler, the Staffilinos were able to stay in business—and their employees kept their jobs.
Randy Johnson joined the VP onstage in Youngstown. He worked for a firm that Mitt Romney and his partners loaded up with debt, driving it into bankruptcy—and costing Randy his job.
Youngstown was ready for the VP.
From creating millions of jobs to bringing our soldiers home from Iraq, take a look at the progress we’ve made under President Obama—then share this video with your friends.
On a trip to Israel in 2010, Vice President Biden and Dr. Jill Biden laid a memorial wreath at the Yad Vashem Holocaust History Museum in Jerusalem.
"No woman should be victimized purely because someone else had more physical power or more economic power."
Vice President Biden makes the case for The Buffett Rule—and talks about what’s at stake for American families this November.

In his speech, Vice President Biden made the case for the Buffett Rule: “In America, we’re not supposed to have a system that's rigged. We’re not supposed to have a system with one set of rules for the very wealthy and one set of rules for everybody else.”
Joe Biden gets some lunch at the Works Bakery Café.

Vice President Biden spoke up for the middle class: “This campaign is going to boil down to a very simple question. Are we going to rebuild an economy with a middle class that’s growing and not shrinking?”
Running mates and friends, from long days on the campaign trail to pushing for landmark health care legislation. Take a look back at the last four years of Barack and Joe.
Don’t miss out on the celebration—sign President Barack Obama's birthday card: http://OFA.BO/cmZpK9
Share this if you agree with Vice President Biden that Congress needs to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act.
Share this if you agree President Obama and Vice President Biden have teachers’ backs.
Election Day is coming up fast. Share this video with your friends, then sign up to get involved together: http://OFA.BO/DmcL5Q
Fans come in all ages—be sure to check out Young Americans for Obama: http://OFA.BO/ELS4jN
“We’re betting on Ohio. We’re betting on the United States of America.”—VP Biden in Columbus, Ohio
Vice President Biden fires up the crowd at the Plumbers & Pipefitters Local Union 189.
“At the end of the day, this is about building the middle class—resilient, sturdy, successful.”—Vice President Biden in Columbus
Share this image if you agree with VP Biden that Barack Obama is a president who “has the character of his convictions."
The choice this November.
The VP wants to buy you a cup of coffee on the campaign trail—and if you donate $30 or more today, you’ll get this Cup of Joe mug along with your chance to join him: http://OFA.BO/EJNE2H

“A job is about a lot more than a paycheck. It’s about your dignity. It’s about your self-respect. It’s about your place in your community. It’s about who you are.”—VP Biden on the road in Ohio. Check out the video highlights, then stay tuned for updates from the President’s visit to Ohio.
The Vice President shaking hands with a young supporter in Davenport, Iowa in March. The VP hit the road today for a Strengthening the Middle Class bus tour through eastern Iowa.
“If you see someone threatening a woman, step up, speak out, and get help.”—Vice President Biden
President Obama has a plan to create a million new jobs for teachers, firefighters, and police officers—the contrast with Romney couldn’t be more clear.
During a visit with Obama for America - North Carolina supporters in Charlotte last week, the Vice President took time to make a special phone call.
Vice President Biden visited Charlotte to rally Obama for America - North Carolina volunteers, who greeted the VP with a chant of “Fired up, ready for Joe!”
Dr. Jill Biden is a lifelong educator, military mom, and women’s health advocate—get to know her better: http://OFA.BO/JoA5G9

“We had good jobs that you could raise a family on.”—Randy Johnson, who worked at a paper plant in Marion, Indiana until Mitt Romney’s firm bought its parent company, loaded it with debt, and fired 1,500 employees while walking away with millions
"If you give them a fair shot, ordinary American people will never, never, never let the country down."—VP Biden in Martins Ferry, Ohio
Vice President Biden greeted supporters at Hogfather’s BBQ in Washington, Pennsylvania.
Lunch break.
Obama for America - Ohio gave the VP a warm welcome.
“If you had to summarize what the President and I intend to do … it’s to put people in a position—moms and dads—to walk up that staircase and say, ‘Everything’s going to be ok.’”
The Vice President stopped to chat with firefighters in Salem, Ohio after his speech.
The Vice President shared some good news about American manufacturing: “Since January 2010, we’ve created 480,000 new manufacturing jobs. Decent-paying jobs.”
The VP's swinging through Ohio this week to talk about middle-class success stories and the return of homegrown manufacturing—stay tuned for updates from the road.

“We’ve made a lot of progress, but the Violence Against Women Act is as important today as it’s ever been. The Senate’s action today reaffirms that addressing this problem is bigger than politics. Now the House needs to act so the President can sign this vital legislation as soon as possible.”—Vice President Biden on the Senate’s decision to reauthorize the VAWA today

“We have to have the single best ground game in the history of presidential politics to counter what is estimated to be hundreds of millions of dollars in raw, negative attack ads.”—Vice President Biden on why it's important to become a part of Obama 2012 in your community. Find out how to get involved: http://OFA.BO/bCGgBW
Little ones got some attention from the Vice President, too.
After his speech, the Vice President stopped by a local coffee shop to chat with Granite Staters.
Vice President Biden is rallying for tax fairness and The Buffett Rule in Exeter, New Hampshire today. You can watch his speech live here at 12:15p.m. ET: http://OFA.BO/ojvxZA
Folks in Davenport were excited to see the Vice President back in Iowa.

“The President and I believe that every American, after a lifetime of hard work, should be able to look forward to the security and dignity that Social Security and Medicare provide.”—Vice President Joe Biden
One of the Vice President's smallest supporters offered him a hug after the speech.

“It's not just manufacturing that’s coming back. The middle class is coming back. America is coming back. Worker by worker, home by home, neighborhood by neighborhood, the country is coming back.”—Vice President Biden in Iowa today

“After years of hearing the word outsourcing, our children are going to hear a new word as much as we heard outsourcing. It’s called insourcing.” —Vice President Biden on the 430,000 manufacturing jobs created in the U.S. since 2010
The VP enjoys a chat with one of his youngest supporters.
“I come here today with a very, very simple message: Manufacturing is back.”—Vice President Joe Biden in Davenport, Iowa

“The President and I have a fundamental commitment to dealing the middle class back in to the American economy that they’ve been dealt out of for so long. And, ultimately, that’s what this election is all about.”—Vice President Biden in Ohio yesterday

“It’s about a choice, a clear choice, between a system that’s rigged and a system that’s fair—a system that says everyone will be held accountable for their actions, not just the middle class. A system that trusts the workers on the line instead of listening to the folks up in the suites. Folks, that’s the choice. It’s a stark choice, and in my mind, it isn’t a choice at all.”
Vice President Biden talks to supporters in Toledo, Ohio about the auto recovery’s success in putting Americans back to work.

Yesterday, Vice President Biden took part in his first-ever Twitter interview from an advanced manufacturing facility in Rochester, New Hampshire. You can see how it went—and find out the Vice President’s pick to win next week’s Super Bowl—here: http://OFA.BO/miuhcH

“We cannot make the point often enough: The government has many obligations, but only one sacred obligation. If we put troops in harm’s way, we have to take care of them when they come home.” – Vice President and Dr. Jill Biden

“The first responders in this country, you are absolutely incredible. To me, this is a simple deal. We owe you. We said we'd give you what you need, and we told the public they'd have what they needed to be protected.”—Vice President Biden calling on Congress to increase funding for police and fire departments

Vice President Joe Biden and Chinese Vice President Xi Jinping greet basketball players at Qingchengshan High School in Dujiangyan, China. The high school has been rebuilt after being severely damaged in the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake.

One of the major challenges facing veterans living in rural areas is how far they've got to travel to reach their nearest VA medical facility. Secretary Eric Shinseki of the Department of Veterans Affairs went on a listening tour this summer to talk to veterans about how the VA can help them get better access to the care and services they need.

“Team USA is a source of pride, unity, and inspiration for millions around the globe – especially girls and other young athletes who know the power that sports have to change lives.”  -- Dr. Jill Biden on her trip to Germany for the Women’s World Cup.

In case you missed it, make sure to check out Vice President Biden's op-ed earlier this week about an initiative he's helping to lead to make government more efficient. "Our government must work harder to make sure that tax dollars are not wasted on government programs that are ineffective, duplicative, or just plain unnecessary," the Vice President wrote.
Vice President Joe Biden, Dr. Jill Biden, and Biden’s granddaughter Finnegan participate in a traditional bread and salt welcoming ceremony in Moscow, Russia.
Vice President Biden welcomes troops home from Afghanistan at Fort Campbell, Kentucky.
Vice President Biden and President Obama en route to the signing of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

President Obama, Vice President Biden, and Solicitor General Elena Kagan wait in the Blue Room of the White House prior to the President's announcement of Kagan as his choice to replace retiring Justice John Paul Stevens on the Supreme Court.
Vice President Joe Biden serves lunch to patients and staff in the dining facility at Walter Reed Army Medical Center on Christmas Day.

“Keep the faith! You are changing women’s lives one woman at a time.”—VP Biden’s message to the National Domestic Violence Hotline Headquarters in Austin, Texas, which he visited just after the hotline received its 2 millionth call
Sen. Joe Biden shares a moment with Ellen before appearing on The Ellen DeGeneres Show.
Sen. Biden meets a supporter in Jefferson City, Missouri.
Sen. Biden takes the stage at a rally in Tampa, Florida.
Sen. Biden meets with the Cudahy, Wisconsin Fire Department.
Sen. Joe Biden addresses a packed town hall meeting in Green Bay, Wisconsin.
Sen. Joe Biden participates in a senior citizens' town hall in Deerfield Beach, Florida.
Sen. Joe Biden stops for barbecue in Denver, Colorado.

The Global AIDS Bill, co-sponsored by Sen. Biden and Sen. Richard Lugar, is signed into law. This historic legislation authorized $48 billion for global HIV/AIDS, malaria, and tuberculosis programs worldwide.
Joe Biden is sworn into the Senate at his sons' bedside in a medical center chapel.
The Vice President got a warm welcome back to the campaign trail from the crowd at UAW Local 12.

Vice President Biden meets with Mexico's President Felipe Calderon in Mexico City in March 2012. The Vice President also visited Tegucigalpa, Honduras to meet with Honduran President Lobo and other Central American leaders.

"The measure of whether or not we have succeeded is whether or not parents can turn to their kids at the end of the day and say, 'It's okay.'"—Vice President Biden visited the American Seating Company in Grand Rapids, Michigan, yesterday to talk about the administration’s commitment to building up America’s businesses for the generations to come
Vice President Biden and Dr. Jill Biden visit wounded troops at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center on Christmas Day.
On Thursday, Vice President Joe Biden had the honor of welcoming home the sailors of the USS Gettysburg after seven months on station in the Middle East.
During a trip to Turkey, Vice President Biden visits a shop in the Samatya Square neighborhood of Istanbul. While in Turkey, Biden spoke at the second Global Entrepreneurship Summit.

Vice President Joe Biden was in Iraq this week to recognize the shared sacrifices of American and Iraqi service members. The Vice President invoked Harry Truman, calling the end of the war a “solemn but glorious hour.”

In Flint, Michigan, Vice President Biden was joined by firefighters and police officers who support President Obama's jobs plan. The President’s proposals would provide $5 billion for communities to hire additional first responders and public safety workers.

Preventing domestic violence has been a cause close to the Vice President’s heart throughout his career. Domestic Violence Awareness Month this October is an opportunity to bring attention to violence against women and families, highlight the progress we’ve made, and evaluate the work that still needs to be done.

October is National Breast Cancer Awareness Month. Dr. Jill Biden and Secretary of Health and Human Services Kathleen Sebelius are talking to breast cancer survivors about how to improve treatment for patients battling cancer.
Vice President Biden spoke in Sendai, Japan today about the rebuilding that’s taking place after March’s tsunami. He reiterated that the United States is committed to helping Japan recover.
President Barack Obama and Vice President Joe Biden shake hands in the Oval Office following a phone call with House Speaker John Boehner on a bipartisan deal to reduce the nation's deficit.

Dr. Jill Biden and First Lady Michelle Obama launched a new initiative yesterday—the Joining Forces Community Challenge. It will recognize individuals and groups across the country who are making a difference in the lives of military families.
Marking Chrysler's repayment of U.S. government loans ahead of schedule, Vice President Joe Biden calls a Chrysler employee at the Jefferson North Plant in Michigan to thank her for her work.
Vice President Joe Biden greets troops during breakfast at Bagram Air Base in Afghanistan.
In his home office in Wilmington, the Vice President calls the Navistar Electric Truck Team to congratulate them on shipping their first vehicle with some help from Recovery Act funding.
President Obama and Vice President Biden wait in the Blue Room of the White House just before the President signs the Affordable Care Act into law.
Vice President Joe Biden stands with President Obama and Supreme Court justices during Sonia Sotomayor's investiture ceremony.
Vice President Joe Biden dances with his wife, Dr. Jill Biden, at an inaugural ball.
Sen. Biden calls voters in Florida.
Sen. Biden prepares for the first Vice Presidential debate at Washington University in St. Louis, Missouri.
Sen. Biden and Dr. Jill Biden receive a warm welcome at a rally in Detroit, Michigan.

Sen. Joe Biden travels to Media, Pennsylvania via Amtrak train—his regular mode of transportation between Wilmington, Delaware and Washington, D.C. Sen. Biden made over 7,000 round trips over the course of his 36-year term in the Senate.
Sen. Joe Biden and Michelle Obama host an economic roundtable with governors and working women during the Democratic National Convention.

The 1994 Crime Bill, which then-Sen. Biden authored, becomes law. In his 2007 book "Promises to Keep," Biden discusses his stance on combating crime: "While I have always been a defender of robust civil liberties for the accused, I have worked hard to give police the tools to fight crime—more cops on the street, better equipment, sentencing guidelines that put people away for committing violent crimes."
Joe Biden's wife Neilia and daughter Naomi are killed in an automobile accident. His sons Beau and Hunter are critically injured.
